a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: National poverty line vs. GDP per capita, 2018
The horizontal lines indicate poverty lines set by the World Bank to be representative of national definitions of
poverty adopted low, lower middle and upper middle income countries respectively.
Note: This data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices, and is therefore adjusted for inflation and for
differences in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: Jolliffe et al. (2022); World Bank
